result.execSummary:
The defendant Toni P. Cayton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber and good time, stayed until on or before June 12, 2015 between 6-7 a.m.  

Defendant also to pay costs (due to the Clerk of Court), within 60 days.

JOC AMENDED 6-26-15:  Counsel stipulate to and Court orders 4 days credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent to Certify Debt to the WI Dept of Revenue; Notice Defaulted on Payment Plan
Toni Cayton called the COC office informs us that his is unable to pay his payment plan this month and will make a payment in December. Approved by Clerk.

counsel stipulate to amendment of JOC to add 4 days credit; Judge Sharp okays this request
Pro Se Request for Time Credit Upon Sentence
Not to commit any further crimes.
from Atty. Franker to clerk re today's hearing

Defendant Toni P. Cayton in court with attorney David William Franker.  Special prosecuting Atty Timothy C. Baxter appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Franker states that the parties are prepared for plea/sentencing; presents Court with plea waiver.  Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy re plea.  Finding of guilty.  DA Baxter addresses the Court.  Baxter states that probation would be his recommendation, however, Def refuses probation; thus, DA is asking for 30 days jail.  Atty. Franker addresses the Court.  Def addresses the Court.  

Sentence:  30 days jail with huber and good time and costs, stayed until on or before June 12, 2015 between 6-7 a.m.  Pay costs.  60 days to pay.

DA Baxter asks if Def will remain on bond until the time that he reports to jail.  Court orders $500 signature bond with conditions that Def not commit any further crimes.
phone call from SPD office - Atty. Franker requests to move the June 3rd status to June 5th in the afternoon; clerk has left a message with DA Baxter's office for him to weigh in on this request
Status conference at 06-03-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Toni P. Cayton in court, in custody (on a sentence for a previous matter) with attorney David William Franker. Prosecuting Atty Timothy C. Baxter appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Franker requests additional status; discovery not fully complete; states def is in custody until date in late May.  Court sets status for June 3 at 1:30.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's...and inspection.
Defendant's...
Status conference at 04-23-2015 01:15 pm
from counsel, request to adjourn the April 10th status
From Toni Cayton re: payplan payment
Status conference at 04-10-2015 03:00 pm

8 cases called together with appearance as follows:

15CM41/initial:  Defendant Toni P. Cayton in court with attorney David William Franker. Prosecuting Atty Timothy C. Baxter appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin as special prosecutor.  14TR1540/status:  Def without counsel and DA Harper for the County.  14CM141, 14CM140, and 14CM171/adjourned initials with Def and Atty. Franker for the Defense and DA Jennifer Harper for the State.  14CM99, 14CM108, and 14CM94/motion hearings on State's motion to revoke DPA's.  

In the cases brought by Richland County and the Richland County DA, DA Harper and Atty. Franker advise the court that the parties have resolution.  DA recites the agreement:  In 14CM94 - 40 days jail each count, all three counts concurrent with each other but consecutive to the jail in 14CM99 and 14CM108.  In 14CM99, jt recomm is 40 days jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  In 14CM108, 40 days jail on each count, concurrent with each other but consecutive to any other jail sentences.  DA - State moves to dismiss all three of other pending cases brought by the Richland County DA - 14CM140, 14CM141, and 14CM171.  DA - State further moves to dismiss 14TR1540.  DA - State has no objection to huber or any other opportunities such as electronic monitoring.  DA - State does not object to stay of the jail.  Atty. Franker - Def requests Friday, April 3rd as jail start date.  Re court costs, Atty. Franker asks that those be "sorted out" with bail money.  Court notes the money was posted by MM.  Def states it was his money.

15CM41 - Atty. Baxter's case:  Atty. Franker states he's not received the complaint.  Clerk prints one for him.  DA Baxter notes that the complaint was served.  Clerk confirms that there is service proof in the file - TC was served with the complaint.  Court allows Atty. Franker an opportunity to review the complaint with the def.  Formal reading waived.  NG entered.  Next hearing will be status.  Court sets 3 p.m. on Friday, April 10th.  DA Baxter may again appear by phone.

DA notes that judgment was withheld in the DPA cases.  Proceeding to judgment in those matters (14CM99, 14CM108, and 14CM94), Court notes that counsel are not presently in full agreement re the amount of jail credit.  Court gives counsel time to figure out credit.  DA states that credit can be determined by stipulation and will be determined prior to def's start date at the jail.

Def addresses the Court.

Court rules, revoking DPAs in 14CM108, 14CM94 , and 14CM99.  Following joint recommendation, Court imposes, in 14CM94 - 40 days jail on each count, concurrent with each other, consecutive to any other sentence serving.  14CM99 - 40 days jail, consecutive to charges in 14CM94.  14CM108 - 40 days on each count, concurrent with each other but consecutive to all other.  Court's intention is for total sentence of 120 days jail.  Huber granted.  Credit for time served in an amount to be determined.  Jail stayed until April 3, 2015 between 6-7 a.m.  Costs of the action on each case.

14TR1540, 14CM141, 14CM140, 14CM171 dismissed and read in as part of the agreement.

60 days to pay court costs.  Court orders clerk to disburse bail money to MM that she had posted in 14CM140 and 14CM141.  Court asks TC how he wants his bail money applied from 14CM171.  Discussion by counsel.  Atty. Franker asks Court to impose only one set of counts per case for total of $729.  DA states she would agree to that only if TC applied the $729 from the bond money that he has in 14CM171.  Court orders one set of costs per case with balance returned to TC.  Status conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
